page.title: 06Shopping
page.content: Shopping in Lydney is a normally quiet and unhurried activity. It comes to life on week-ends with grocery buying and the open-air market bringing in crowds from outside areas. Most groceries are bought from the three supermarkets. The small grocery shops get their sales from mid-week buying and casual purchases such as sweets and cigarettes. Do it Yourself materials,clothes, furniture and electrical and audio- visual goods are all available though some mums buy these in Gloucester for greater choice and competitive prices. Most shops are on the long, main street. In recent years some shops and banks from the top end of the town have moved to the bottom end. This is controversial as is the move to close the main post office leaving only a counter service in a newsagent's shop.
